description: Minor Material Amendment (S73) to vary condition 2 (drawings) of planning application Ref 173577FUL dated 25/04/2018 for 'Construction of a third, fourth and fifth roof level extension and part four and five storey rear extension (following demolition of the existing three storey rear extension) for the creation of ten self-contained residential units; 440.5sqm of retail floorspace (Use Class A1); 68sqm of flexible use floorspace (Use Class A1, A2 or B1a); cycle and refuse/recycling storage.' Variation seeking to amend drawings (Condition 2) and to take account of rearrangement of cycle parking, insertion of columns to the frontage of the building, change in external doors and opening arrangement, various external detail alterations to the building, and insertion of new metal/timber fencing along the eastern and northern frontages of the site
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original planning permission 173577FUL, dated 25/04/2018.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): PL101 - Site Location Plan; PL102 - Existing & Proposed Site Plans; PL103 - Existing Grd &1st Flr Plans; PL104 - Existing 2nd & Roof Plans; PL105 - Existing Elevations (1 of 3); PL106- Existing Elevations (2 of 3); PL107 - Existing Elevations (3 of 3); PL108 rev C - Proposed Coloured Site Plan; PL109 rev I - Proposed Ground Floor; PL110 rev C - Proposed First Floor; PL111 rev C - Proposed Second Floor; PL112 rev C - Proposed Third Floor; PL113 rev E - Proposed Fourth Floor; PL114 rev D - Proposed Fifth Floor; PL115 rev C  - Proposed Roof Plan; PL116 rev I - Proposed Front & Rear Elevation; PL117 rev I - Proposed Eastern Side; Elevation; PL118 rev E - Proposed Western Side Elevation; PL119 - Proposed Sections; PL128 Rev E - Cycling storage layouts; PL129 Rev C- Cycling storage elevations; Air Quality Statement produced by Ramboll Environ dated 22/06/2017; Daylight & Sunlight Report produced by CHP Surveyors Ltd dated 23/06/2017; Desk-based Archaeological Assessment dated June 2017; Drainage Strategy prepared by RST West London Ltd dated 07/06/2017; Draft Delivery and Servicing Plan prepared by Vectos dated September 2017; Energy, Sustainability Report Ref 4603/MW/ES3 dated Oct 2017; Noise Impact Assessment report no.R01A produced by Ramboll Environ dated 23/06/2017; Planning and Heritage Statement prepared by Powerhaus Consultancy dated 26/06/2017; Transport Assessment produced by Vectos (South) ltd dated June 2017; Transport Response Letter ref 043 dated 13/10/2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| The schedule of materials as approved in consent 201708CND dated 05.02.2021 shall be implemented in full in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f) and 3.8 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D1, D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021)
| The refuse and recycling shown on the approved drawings and documents shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of all units which the store(s) serves and retained thereafter.

Reason: To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy D6 and Table 3.2 of the London Plan(2021); Policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013); and (interim) SPG 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities.

| The cycle storage shown on the approved documents and drawings shall be in implemented prior to the first occupation of the development to demonstrate the provision of at least 36 cycle parking spaces and carried out to the specifications and adopted standards of the London Plan and the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with Policy T5 and Table 10.2 of the London Plan(2021);  policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.

| The 1.8 metre high privacy screening to the roof terraces of Flats 1, 2, 5, 6, 8, 9, and 10, as indicated on drawings: PL110 rev C - Proposed First Floor; PL112 rev C - Proposed Third Floor; PL113 rev E - Proposed Fourth Floor; PL114 rev D - Proposed Fifth Floor; PL116 rev I - Proposed Front & Rear Elevation; PL117 rev I - Proposed Eastern Side Elevation; PL118 rev E - Proposed Western Side Elevation; shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013; policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021); policies 1.1 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012)

| The obscure glazed windows as indicated on drawings: PL110 rev B - Proposed First Floor; PL111 rev C - Proposed Second Floor; PL112 rev C - Proposed Third Floor; PL116 rev I - Proposed Front & Rear Elevation; PL117 rev I - Proposed Eastern Side Elevation; PL118 rev E - Proposed Western Side Elevation; shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, Policies 1.1 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021).

| Noise Mitigation measures, with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided, shall insulate the new dwellings against the transmission of externally generated noise, to meet the minimum internal ambient noise criteria as specified in Table 4 of BS 8233:2014; Living Rooms, Bedrooms = 35 dB LAeq,16 hours ; Kitchens, Dining Rooms, Bathrooms = 40 dB LAeq,16 hours during day-time hours (07:00 - 23:00); and Bedrooms = 30 dB LAeq,8 hours during night-time hours (23:00 - 07:00). The Mitigation Measures shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the residential units and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies D3, D4 and D14 of the London Plan(2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The rating sound level emitted from the external plant and machinery at the development hereby approved, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: To safeguard future and existing occupiers of the area against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan(2021); policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation Policy 3.5 and 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed within the development unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under this condition prior to installation.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole, in accordance with Policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policies 3.5 and 7.4 and policies 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); and policies D1, D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021). | The passenger lift and staircases located within the communal core serving the residential units to the upper floors shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development.

Reason: To ensure that adequate access is provided to all floors of the development for all occupiers and visitors including those with disabilities, in accordance with policies D5 and D7 of the London Plan(2021); Policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and interim Ealing SPG 'Accessible Ealing' (2012).

| Commercial Unit 1 (as identified in drawing number: PL109 rev I - Proposed Ground Floor) at ground floor level shall be used as retail unit within Use Class E (shop) and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in all other classes of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2020 amendment of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).

Commercial Unit 2 (as identified in drawing number: PL109 rev I - Proposed Ground Floor) at ground floor level shall be for 'flexible' Use Class E, or Use Class F.1 (art gallery only); and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in all other classes of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2020 amendment of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).

Reason: To ensure that alternative uses are not accommodated without consideration of the impacts on transport and highways and the amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with policies in accordance Policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); Policies 4A, 4B and 4C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies SD6 and SD8 of the London Plan(2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The Construction Logistics Plan approved under consent 185040CND shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site. If during the course of any works a change to the approved plan is required, these shall be approved in writing prior to any changes taking place. The site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy T7 of the London Plan(2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan and National Planning Policy Framework (2019)

| The piling method statement approved under consent 191364CND shall be implemented in full. If during the course of the approved work any changes to this method statement are required, these shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to moving forward with any alternative works.
Reason: The proposed works would be in close proximity to underground water and sewerage utility infrastructure, which needs to be safeguarded in accordance with policy SI5 of the London Plan(2021).
| Any external lighting scheme shall be designed to reduce light pollution to nearby residents, and road users and where applicable the recommendations of the following guidance shall be met:
o	ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011;
o	Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report No 5, Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements;
o	CIE Technical Report- Guide on the Limitation of the Effects of Obtrusive Light from Outdoor Lighting Installations - CIE 150: 2003;
o	Statutory Nuisance from Insects and Artificial Light by Department of Environment Food. Guidance on sections 101, 102 and 103 of the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005, Defra.

Reason: In the interests of the safety and amenity of future users and occupiers of the site, to prevent excessive light disturbance to the Gunnersbury Triangle Nature Reserve and to ensure the safe operation of the railway, in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021); and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013).

| A) Within three-months of the first occupation of each dwelling in the approved development, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's], detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the DER and TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.

B) Within three-months of the practical completion of the dwellings evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

C) Prior to the final completion of the residential units, the approved residential part of the scheme shall incorporate, maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 37.4% (equal to 5.57 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Issue 3 (13 October 2017) prepared by AGP Consultants Ltd.:

i. energy saving measures and gas fired communal heating system to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 3.78 tonnes CO2 equating to 25.38% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

ii. incorporation of at least 4kWp solar PV system to generate at least 3.58MWh/year electricity and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 1.79 tonnes CO2 equating to 16.12% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the Be Lean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason: To ensure that the dwellings within the development hereby approved are energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies SI1, SI2, SI3 and SI4 of the London Plan(2021), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | A) Within three-months of the practical completion of the non-domestic spaces, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports for each space showing clearly the BER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

B) Within three-months of the practical completion of the non-domestic spaces, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies, are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

C) Prior to the final completion of the non-domestic spaces, the approved units shall incorporate, maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35% (equal to 2.32 tonnesCO2/yr) through energy efficiency measures, domestic hot water from communal heating system serving the dwellings and 2.2kW ASHP (cooling) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Issue 3 (13 October 2017) prepared by AGP Consultants Ltd.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason: To ensure that the non-domestic spaces within the development hereby approved are energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies SI1, SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan(2021);  policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | All boilers accommodated in the plant room to serve the energy requirements of the development, including space heating and hot water to the dwellings and hot water to the non-domestic spaces, should use Ultra low-NOx boilers with maximum NOx Emissions of under 0.030 g/kWh and be compliant with the NOx (g/mÂ²) benchmarks as set out at Appendix 5 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); policy SI3 of the London Plan(2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Existing trees adjacent/close to the boundaries of the site shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees. Protection of the trees, hedgerows and groups of mature shrubs off site that are adjacent/close to it shall be carried out only in accordance with British Standard 5837:2005 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations' (or any subsequent revision), and shall be maintained fully intact and (in the case of the fencing) at all times, until the completion of all building operations on the site.

Reason: In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity and improving biodiversity of the area as a whole, policy G5 of the London Plan(2021), policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the London Environment Strategy (2018). | The finalised Delivery and Servicing Management as approved in consent 204277CND shall be implemented strictly in accordance with these details.

Reason: To ensure that the delivery arrangements to the building as a whole are appropriate and to limit the effects of the increase in travel movements and impacts on neighbouring amenity in accordance policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); Policies 4B and 4C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policy T7 of the London Plan(2021)

| The drainage strategy approved under consent 191658CND detailing any on and/or off site drainage works, shall be implemented in full. Any changes to the approved scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any changes being made.

Reason: To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies SI12 and SI13 of the London Plan(2021)and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The approved targeted investigation for further risk assessment to identify pollutants approved under consent 191659CND and consent 204413CND

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in accordance policy 5.21 of The Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); Policy 5.21 of the London Plan (2016); policy SD1 of the London Plan(2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
